content.p: /coCT/ is an Original Character Tournament hosted on the /co/ 4chan board.
OCTs are fun, so I decided to try hosting one on /co/, which is what I browse when I'm mentally unwell.

Eight contestants entered their characters, and made comics of their opponents. Each round, I would decide which comic would continue, until only one story was the canon series of events for the tournament.

It was a lot of fun, though keeping it up and running required me to be glued to 4chan almost 24/7, which isn't good for someone's brain. I'd love to see them continue, but it's so easy to lose track of competitors and for threads to go under. There's probably a reason 4chan isn't a usual venue for long-running tournaments. Still, I had fun, and I hope the competitors did, too.

This is an archive for the tournament, containing every image I can remember being posted. If you want anything more uploaded, uh I have no idea how to message me reliably without also getting even more spam on my phone and email. Probably my Mastodon page? I could check that. There'll also probably be a few more /coCT/ threads in the future. I'm still waiting on IceLolly's comic, after all.

div.p: A half-bag, half-man, all muscle rough-and-tumbler looking for a good, honest fight.
The elusive and mysterious swamp thing, drawn to the tournament's bright lights.

A character pulled from a cancelled game by Flargy-Filler and repurposed by a fan for this tournament, she's a girl who just wants to fight monsters caught in the tournament after getting killed and sent to Hell.
An immortal Baradostian meat creature who's always hungry.
A gnarled filthy imp who drives people to act on their impulsive thoughts. This reference image also doubles as the audition comic, an inspiring example of efficiency and ingenuity.
A young heroine teaching children how to stay safe online, though she spends most of her time getting caught in the very traps she's trying to teach people to avoid.
A necromancer who turned himself into a skeleton, as was the fashion of the time, but is sick of it and hopes winning the tournament will grant him living flesh again.
A beetle-man mercenary raised in a lab and hardened by tragedy. While hard and bitter, he's perhaps not the ball of violence he seems.
